headline: The Advanced Imaging Society Announces Winners of 16th Annual Lumiere Awards
summary: LOS ANGELES, February 10, 2026--The Advanced Imaging Society has announced the winners of the 2026 Lumiere Awards, recognizing outstanding creative and technical achievements during its 16th annual celebration. The awards honor the artists, engineers, and innovators whose work continues to push the boundaries of storytelling and cinematic technology.

headline: Alphabet’s 100 Year Bond Underscores Multi Decade AI And Waymo Buildout
summary: Alphabet (NasdaqGS:GOOGL) is issuing a 100 year bond to fund a large scale AI infrastructure build out. The company is pairing this with multi billion dollar renewable energy deals with TotalEnergies for Google data centers in Texas. Waymo, Alphabet's self driving unit, is pursuing aggressive expansion alongside these long dated capital and energy commitments. For you as an investor, this move highlights how far Alphabet is taking its AI first identity across cloud, search and autonomous...

headline: Alphabet Bets Big on 100 Years of Debt
summary: Alphabet is breaking new ground with plans to sell a rare 100 year bond - the first ultra long debt sale by a technology firm since Motorola in 1997. Bloomberg's Peter Elstrom explains why this century long bond is unusual, what it signals about Alphabet's strategy, and how it fits into the broader market for ultra long maturities.

content.title: Alphabet Bets Big on 100 Years of Debt

Bloomberg's Peter Elstrom explains why this century long bond is unusual, what it signals about Alphabet's strategy, and how it fits into the broader market for ultra long maturities.

headline: Alibaba Pushes Into Robotics AI With Open-Source ‘RynnBrain’
summary: The Chinese company’s DAMO Academy introduced an open-source foundation model that engages with the environment, understands space in relation to time and can figure out steps toward completing a task.  With the release, Alibaba takes on AI leaders including Alphabet Inc.’s Google and Nvidia Corp. The Chinese firm claimed state-of-the-art results on benchmarks against Google’s Gemini Robotics-ER 1.5 and Nvidia’s Cosmos-Reason2.  Trained on Alibaba’s Qwen3-VL vision language model, RynnBrain is available on platforms like Hugging Face and GitHub in multiple versions starting as small as 2 billion parameters to a more efficient mixture-of-experts version.

content.title: Alibaba Pushes Into Robotics AI With Open-Source ‘RynnBrain’
content.summary: The Chinese company’s DAMO Academy introduced an open-source foundation model that engages with the environment, understands space in relation to time and can figure out steps toward completing a task.  With the release, Alibaba takes on AI leaders including Alphabet Inc.’s Google and Nvidia Corp. The Chinese firm claimed state-of-the-art results on benchmarks against Google’s Gemini Robotics-ER 1.5 and Nvidia’s Cosmos-Reason2.  Trained on Alibaba’s Qwen3-VL vision language model, RynnBrain is available on platforms like Hugging Face and GitHub in multiple versions starting as small as 2 billion parameters to a more efficient mixture-of-experts version.

headline: Tech Weekly: big tech in court, Alibaba's AI Olympic fashion
summary:
STORY: From big tech in the dock to Alibaba's AI helping winter Olympic guests choose outfits. 

This is Tech Weekly.

:: Tech Weekly

Meta Platforms and YouTube deliberately designed products they knew would addict children.

That's what a lawyer for a woman suing the Big Tech companies told jurors in California.

The trial will test whether Big Tech platforms can be held liable for their app design.

The 20-year-old woman identified as Kaley G.M. in court is suing Instagram-parent Meta Platforms and YouTube-owner, Alphabet's Google,.

Her lawyer says she was hooked on social media at a young age because of the apps' addictive design.

The Australian government has called a meeting with gaming platform Roblox.

It's over reports of child grooming and exposure to graphic content on the platform.

While a regulator said it will test whether Roblox had delivered on child-safety commitments.

Researchers at the University of Bristol are developing soft robotic "exosuit" trousers worn under a spacesuit.

They say it could help astronauts move more naturally while reducing lower-limb fatigue during future Moon and Mars missions.

The team said the technology could also support mobility and physical rehabilitation on Earth.

Including systems that either assist movement or add resistance to help maintain muscle mass.

Elon Musk has said that SpaceX has shifted its focus to building a "self‑growing city" on the moon.

He says this could be achieved in less than 10 years.

Musk wrote on his X social media platform that SpaceX still intends to start on his long-held ambition of a city on Mars within five to seven years.

But that the quote, "overriding priority is securing the future of civilization and the Moon is faster."

Alibaba's AI tech is helping Olympic guests dress up in Milan.

From slick outfits to tailored makeup and elegant fragrance, Alibaba is offering visitors a futuristic shopping experience powered by latest AI technology.

In the “Wonder on Ice” showcase, visitors explore the virtual retail and an avatar of their own being created.

“Ciao, Claire. Finally we meet. I’m so glad you accepted our invitation to this fantasy gala.”

Visitors can then select their preferred clothing and makeup styles with recommendations made by a virtual guide.

content.title: Tech Weekly: big tech in court, Alibaba's AI Olympic fashion

:: Tech Weekly

The 20-year-old woman identified as Kaley G.M. in court is suing Instagram-parent Meta Platforms and YouTube-owner, Alphabet's Google,.

Her lawyer says she was hooked on social media at a young age because of the apps' addictive design.

It's over reports of child grooming and exposure to graphic content on the platform.

While a regulator said it will test whether Roblox had delivered on child-safety commitments.

Researchers at the University of Bristol are developing soft robotic "exosuit" trousers worn under a spacesuit.

They say it could help astronauts move more naturally while reducing lower-limb fatigue during future Moon and Mars missions.

The team said the technology could also support mobility and physical rehabilitation on Earth.

Including systems that either assist movement or add resistance to help maintain muscle mass.

Elon Musk has said that SpaceX has shifted its focus to building a "self‑growing city" on the moon.

Musk wrote on his X social media platform that SpaceX still intends to start on his long-held ambition of a city on Mars within five to seven years.

But that the quote, "overriding priority is securing the future of civilization and the Moon is faster."

Alibaba's AI tech is helping Olympic guests dress up in Milan.

From slick outfits to tailored makeup and elegant fragrance, Alibaba is offering visitors a futuristic shopping experience powered by latest AI technology.

In the “Wonder on Ice” showcase, visitors explore the virtual retail and an avatar of their own being created.

“Ciao, Claire. Finally we meet. I’m so glad you accepted our invitation to this fantasy gala.”

Visitors can then select their preferred clothing and makeup styles with recommendations made by a virtual guide.

headline: Alphabet sells bonds worth $20 billion to fund AI spending
summary: Alphabet has sold bonds worth $20 billion in a seven-part offering, tapping the debt market to fund ​its surging spending on artificial intelligence infrastructure.  The disclosure on ‌Tuesday underscored Big Tech's growing appetite for credit, in a shift away from ‌years of relying on strong cash flows to fund investment in new technologies.  Their ‌capital expenditure is expected to total at least $630 billion this year, with most of spending focused on ‍data-centers and the AI chips that power them.

content.title: Alphabet sells bonds worth $20 billion to fund AI spending
content.summary: Alphabet has sold bonds worth $20 billion in a seven-part offering, tapping the debt market to fund ​its surging spending on artificial intelligence infrastructure.  The disclosure on ‌Tuesday underscored Big Tech's growing appetite for credit, in a shift away from ‌years of relying on strong cash flows to fund investment in new technologies.  Their ‌capital expenditure is expected to total at least $630 billion this year, with most of spending focused on ‍data-centers and the AI chips that power them.

headline: Alphabet plans to sell rare 100-year bond in huge multi-currency debt raise
summary: Google’s parent company Alphabet is planning to sell a rare 100-year bond in British pounds after its original $20bn (€16.8bn) US dollar bond sale was massively oversubscribed. This would make it the first tech company to attempt a century bond since Motorola in 1997.View on euronews

This would make it the first tech company to attempt a century bond since Motorola in 1997.View on euronews

headline: Apple and Google agree app store changes to appease UK regulator
summary: Apple and Google have agreed to make their mobile app stores fairer and more ​transparent for thousands of developers, Britain's antitrust regulator ‌said on Tuesday, hailing it as important first steps in its tougher regime.  The ‌Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) designated the two tech giants as having "strategic market status" in smartphones in October, giving it the power to demand specific changes to boost competition.  Nearly all smartphones in ⁠Britain run either Apple ‌iOS or Google's Android operating systems, and their app stores and browsers have exclusive or dominant ‍positions on their platforms.

content.title: Apple and Google agree app store changes to appease UK regulator

headline: Big Investors Doubled Down on AI Stocks, Study Finds
summary: University endowments, charities and the ultrawealthy increased investments in artificial intelligence-related stocks last year, according to a research brief expected to be published Tuesday.  It found the biggest increases in exposure in 2025 were in two categories of stocks: those classified as information technology and those classified as communication services—a group that includes Alphabet and Meta Platforms.  The analysis focused on book value to filter out the impact of many tech and communications stocks’ rapid increase in market value.

content.title: Big Investors Doubled Down on AI Stocks, Study Finds
content.summary: University endowments, charities and the ultrawealthy increased investments in artificial intelligence-related stocks last year, according to a research brief expected to be published Tuesday.  It found the biggest increases in exposure in 2025 were in two categories of stocks: those classified as information technology and those classified as communication services—a group that includes Alphabet and Meta Platforms.  The analysis focused on book value to filter out the impact of many tech and communications stocks’ rapid increase in market value.
